alert.note: Alert for Monroe (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 03 at 3:44AM CST until February 03 at 10:18PM CST by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Mississippi... Tombigbee River at Bigbee For the Tombigbee River...including Fulton, Bigbee, Amory, Aberdeen L & D...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Tombigbee River at Bigbee. * WHEN...Until late this evening. * IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, flooding of low-lying agricultural land is occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:30 AM CST Friday the stage was 14.8 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 2:30 AM CST Friday was 14.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is at crest now and will begin to fall. It is expected to fall below flood stage by late afternoon. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at weather.gov/memphis. The next statement will be issued as conditions warrant.
